Yes there is -- but I’m afraid that will soon be gone. (gently) Theodora’s doomed. She’s tried to resist her sister and the wickedness within her for the longest time -- but that time, I think, is about to run out... and even you can’t save her.
And on this, you’ll notice, we made a few modifications. Oz is examining one of the completed contraptions. Kala’s here with him.
We thought if you added a few more of these -- here, here, and here -- instead of this it should look more like that, rounded instead of flat. Oz studies the schematics -- then looks up.
You're a genius. A genius on par with the Great Edison himself!
Try telling that to my wife. (moves to next table) Now over here we've got...
My father died a broken man... INT. GLINDA’S LIBRARY - THAT NIGHT FLAMES IN THE FIREPLACE. OZ AND GLINDA -- alone.  72.

He was a preacher, who went from dusty town to dusty town selling dreams of a better life and a better world -- but this world and this life beat him down to next to nothing, and even as a child I promised myself that was not gonna happen to me. I might’ve come from the dirt but I always believed my future was in the stars. (looks over at her) And I believe that future is now -- I can feel it -- my whole life’s been leading up to this.
I believe that too. I believe this is your Destiny. (beat) And I believe in you, Wizard. He gazes at her for quite a while, then, finally...
You_know I’m not a Wizard. Of course she does. She reaches over, takes his hand.
But you are a good man -- and sometimes that’s enough.
Glinda... She shakes her head, tells him --

Get some rest. Tomorrow the future begins. EXT. GLINDA’S CASTLE - NEXT MORNING 0Z'S ARMY is here in force -- flags and standards flappin the breeze -- UTENSILS... HAMMERHEADS... PAPER SOLDIERS.. FUDDLES -- ready to march. DAINTY CHINA PEOPLE are here t wave their heroes off -- some of the DAINTY CHINA GIRLS s caught up in the moment they’re actually CRYING SOLID DAI CHINA TEARS -- which fall like pebbles to the ground -- o shatter into powder.  73. KALA helps Glinda onto a pure white steed. A FOOTMAN lead second horse to Oz -- who can’t help but notice that the horse’s coat is an ever-changing kaleidoscope of color.
What kind of horse is this?
Why it’s a Horse of a Different Color, sir.
Of course it is. Oz mounts, then wheels and gives his troops his best Henr

My friends! Back where I come from we have a saying: Ad astra per aspera -- it’s the motto of the Great State of Kansas and in Wizard- speak it means: “To the stars, through difficulties.” We also say: E Pluribus Unum: “Out of many, one.” And that is us today: One people -- one army -- and, together, we shall reach the stars! Are you with me! (the Army roars back a resounding YES!) Are you with me! A louder YES! -- then, to Glinda, under his breath --
This is your last chance to talk me out of this. Glinda just smiles -- then shouts out to the troops:

head_text.subj: TO OZ AND THE EMERALD CITY

text: The Army starts to march -- the China People wave and wee and hurrah -- and we PULL BACK and UP and we go -- INT. THRONE ROOM - EVANORA’S PALACE The Wicked Sisters are SEEING 0Z'S ARMY IN THE CRYSTAL.  74.
And so they march. Soon there will be no more sand in the hourglass... soon you must decide... Theodora turns to her -- fretful -- torn -- and we go --

Oz‘s Army approaches the border -- everything on the othe side wavy, mirage-like -- then Glinda sweeps an arm, and SHIMMERING WALL DISAPPEARS -- Central Oz is now clear as bell. Oz himself looks skyward.
Nice day we’re having... but I’m told the weather around here can change just like that. -- snapping his fingers -- then Glinda smiles --
Actually it’s more like this... And she slowly raises her arms, calling forth:

A WALL OF WHITE comes ROARING in out of nowhere and engul the whole of Oz’s Army in a HOWLING BLIZZARD -- FROM ABOVE WE SEE THE STORM spreading over them -- spread wide -- spreading miles in every direction -- wide enough that it would be impossible to pinpoint the Army’s locati and the strangest thing is... WITH THE ARMY -- INSIDE THE STORM -- the weather here is. perfectly calm. It’s like they’re in the eye of a wintry hurricane -- in the middle of a parted Red Sea -- with towering clouds VORTEXING above and all around them -- a swirling ceiling, whirling walls -- but down here at grou level, there’s only the slightest breeze...
You, m’lady, are magnificent. (then, to the troops) Abracadabra, ad astra per aspera and E Pluribus Unum! And as the Army moves forward -- THE CALM EYE OF THE STOR MOVES WITH THEM...  75.
And still you hesitate...
THE SISTERS -- gazing into the Crystal -- seeing the Stor

What’s it going to take, Sister? Do you intend to wait until they’re inside the city gates?... (suddenly grabs Theodora by the hair) I_cannot wait any longer! I need you and I need you NOW! Theodora wrenches free -- Evanora keeps at it, keeps on h

What are you so frightened of! WHAT ARE YOU HOLDING ON TO! He doesn’t love you! He will never love you! He is coming here to KILL you! Once again THE DIAMOND DAGGER magically appears in her ha she savagely stabs it into the table, embedding the blade the wood.
The time has come -- you must ACCEPT the Evil inside of you! You must EMBRACE THE HATE! Theodora -- eyes on the Dagger -- finally shrieks --
ALRIGHT! Stop it! -- alright! -- I'll do it... Evanora suppresses a smile -- crooks a finger --
Come. INT. GRAND DINING ROOM - EVANORA’S PALACE - MOMENTS LATER Theodora’s seated at the table -- staring -- as Evanora D POTION from a vial on a SHINY RED APPLE -- drop by drop..
Will it hurt?  76.
Fleetingly. Then you'll never feel pain again.
Nor love.

What good has love ever done you? What good has good ever done you? (the apple’s ready) There now. One bite is all it takes. One bite, and the world will change forever... one bite, and you'll be able to fly... one bite -- or Glinda will soon be seated on the Emerald Throne -- as_ the Wizard's Blessed Queen... That does it: Theodora snatches up the apple, takes a sav bite, and almost immediately it begins: THEODORA’S TRANSFORMATION A violent inner upheaval -- the sudden shock and pain of flashing across her face -- she PUSHES BACK FROM THE TABL hand to her chest -- CONVULSING -- shrieking --
WHAT’S HAPPENING TO ME!

(soothingly) That’s only what’s left of your heart... withering away. Soon, my pretty, you’ll feel nothing at all except... beautiful wickedness. Theodora’s gasping, fighting for air -- face and body contorted -- she sinks to the floor -- hunched over -- fo in on herself -- face hidden -- her breathing slows, then
Oh yes... yes... now I understand. And as she lifts her face we see: Her CHIN has lengthened her NOSE has hooked and grown... and HER SKIN HAS TURNED COMPLETELY GREEN -- and she has become:

head_text.subj: THE WICKED WITCH OF THE WEST

text: She sees her hand -- sees the color -- feels her nose and chin -- goes to the Mirror on the Wall... gazes at hersel  77.
A simple enchantment can have you looking just the way you were... if you want.
No. This is me now. She whirls around -- lurches to the window -- flings it o -- orders the SAVAGE GENERALS waiting in the courtyard be
Keep only enough of you here to protect the Palace and the Queen. The rest of you: You will exterminate the Wizard's Army -- but leave the Wizard himself for me! Now go -- GO!
But... who are you? A beat -- then Theodora CACKLES -- proudly proclaims --
The Generals storm off, as --
Hurry, Wizard -- I want to dance with you again -- a different dance this time -- a wedding dance... I got married, you see -- to Wickedness -- and from now on: The bride will wear only black!
THE SAVAGE ARMY thunders out of the city -- Gnomes, Whims Growleywogs, Winged Monkeys --
The Savages flood onto the Great Plain -- fanning out -- then, look out, here it comes -- GLINDA’S STORM -- A ROLLING, BILLOWING WALL OF WHITE

It SLAMS into the Savage Army -- with shrieking winds -- slashing ice and snow -- the Winged Monkeys are flung fro the sky like rag dolls -- and all the Savage Army can do hunker down right where they are -- huddled together -- s they're covered, mounded in snow, and --
Theodora fights to shut the window against the wind -- finally gets it closed -- wheels to face her sister --
Look at you -- calm as a clam.
A storm like this is no easy task, even for a Sorceress as powerful as Glinda. The longer it lasts...
-- the weaker she’1l become --
And when it ends we'll get to see what kind of a Wizard this Wizard really is... if he’s the Wizard everyone says he is...
You don’t believe, Sister?
I believe we shall see. EXT. WITH OZ’S ARMY - IN THE EYE OF THE STORM - EARLY EVE Oz is watching Glinda closely -- and the Sisters were rig The storm has clearly weakened her. Oz glances at Kala.
How much further?
We're here. And as the wall of snow in front of us recedes we see:
A jumble of boulders fifty feet high.  79.
The Caves are under there? How do we get in?

Magic. -- looking to Glinda -- and she summons up the last of he strength, circles her hand in the air, and... THE STORM WALLS START CLOSING IN ON THEM -- narrowing and lifting to form a spiralling FUNNEL overhead -- Glinda directs this snaky funnel over to the Pyramid -- to one particular HUGE BOULDER -- and THE FUNNEL PICKS IT UP AND WHISKS IT AWAY just like Dorothy’s Farmhouse, revealing:

THE MOUTH OF THE CAVES. Oz, impressed, turns to complimen Glinda, just as her eyes roll up in her head -- Oz leaps his horse, CATCHES GLINDA AS SHE FALLS -- passed out. THE STORM IS OVER. Night’s falling fast. Oz carries Glind into the Caves, while --
The Storm has ended here, too -- the Savages are digging themselves out of the snow -- a GNOME GENERAL is saying -
Let’s get some fires going. We’1l camp here tonight.
Torchlight reveals: A SUBTERRANEAN WONDERLAND -- a vast central cavern -- towering stalactites and stalagmites -- underground river -- tunnels stretching into the darkness
The tunnels, they go all the way under the Impassable Desert right into the Savage Lands.
(still holding Glinda) So that’s how the Savages got here.
Evanora, she brought them in -- to help her fight-fight Glinda’s father. He’s the one who closed the Caves, just before he died.  80.
How did he die?
I thought you knew. He died saving Glinda. Evanora, she killed him. (then) Come-come, we find a place to lay her down.

location: A CHAPEL-LIKE HOLLOW IN THE CAVE WALL

text: Oz gently sets Glinda down inside it.

They were friends, you know -- Glinda and Evanora... and Evanora, she used that friendship, used Glinda’s goodness to trick-trick and trap her, because she knew that Glinda’s Father the King would do everything in his power to save her... and that’s when Evanora, she struck like a snake. Glinda, she saw her father die.
Killed by her friend. (echoes Theodora) She had no idea how wicked wickedness could be, or how easily friendship could be betrayed. (then) How long will she sleep?
Whatever you do, don’t try to waky- wake her with a kiss. We need you, Wizard.
(a quizzical look, then) Let’s get everyone ready.
Sparks fly as, one by one, Scissors, Knives and Cleavers up to hone their blades against live spinning Whetstones.

Next! -- let’s go! -- look sharp!  81. Oz passes by -- and a little further on we see: TWO HAMMERHEADS -- HARASSING A PAPER SOLDIER -- using their breaths to huff and puff him back and forth between them.
C’mon, boys, leave him alone. The Hammerheads scowl, but stop. Kala appears.
The Munchkins, they are here.

EMERALD CITY MUNCHKINS -- Glinda and Kala’s inside guys - are helping the Smith & Tinker Elves load their stuff ont small wagons and carts, pulled by MINIATURE HORSES. Oz an Kala are with the main MUNCHKIN, who’s named M.
We’re counting on you.
And the Good People of Oz are counting on you. Both smile, shake hands.
See you in Emerald City. (then --) What’s the matter?
Nothing, just... thought you’d be bigger. -- and this from a guy about three feet tall -- and as he climbs on his tiny horse he says --
The others will be here before first light. The Munchkins and the Elves start out.
Still asleep -- then her eyes butterfly open -- she sees sitting nearby -- he’s been watching her sleep. He smiles  82.
You're awake.
And restored.
We're ready whenever you are.
Oz stands with arms as extended, as those freshly-sharpen Scissors and Knives and Cleavers climb up his legs and to

and_settle themselves in -- in his belt -- in his pockets he’s soon sheathed in steel, bristling with blades -- oth honed Utensils are loading themselves onto Kala -- still others are stepping into a rucksack -- which Oz loops ove his shoulders -- then he looks to Glinda --
Let’s do it.
Step closer. Oz does -- Glinda makes a little motion with her hand -- the two of them are enveloped by THE MAGIC BUBBLE -- 0Z -- INSIDE THE BUBBLE -- marveling -- excited --
Sure beats a broomstick doesn’t it? THE MAGIC BUBBLE AND KALA FLY OFF, to --

OVERLOOKING THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT. The Savage Army is asle a grunting, snoring, wheezing, scratching, mumbling sleep Then we see, coming out of the night sky to the south: THE MAGIC BUBBLE -- AND KALA. They land on the ridge overlooking the encampment, then head down the hill with and the Knives and Scissors and Cleavers -- INTO THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT -- where quickly, quietly, the Utensils climb off Oz and Kala and out of the rucksack, a they all get to work CLIPPING AND CHOPPING OFF THE GNOMES BEARDS -- AND SLICING THE MASKS OFF THE WHIMSIE WARRIORS.
And we get our first look at the Whimsies real heads -- a they really are just appallingly, embarrassingly small. O and Glinda and Kala keep snipping and shearing, and we --

Just before dawn. Oz and Glinda and Kala return with the Utensils -- Mission Accomplished, safe and sound -- to fi MUNCHKINS have arrived with MINIATURE MUNCHKIN HORSE-DRAW HAY WAGONS AND OX CARTS. Cuttenclip Soldiers are marching out of the Cave and loading themselves onto the carts and wagons -- laying themselves flat, one on top of the other that hundreds can be stacked together and still only be a high as a couple of reams of paper. The Munchkin teamster then COVER THEM UP WITH HAY. We also see: THE FUDDLES and THE HAMMERHEADS are ready to move out together. Oz shakes Farnsworth Fuddle’s hand.

Safe journey. Keep yourselves together, men! (then, to the Hammerheads) And you boys, use your heads! Give ‘em what-for! The Army starts out -- the Hammerheads and Fuddles headin west -- the Munchkins heading north with the hay-hidden P Soldiers. THE GREAT PLAIN OF OZ - THE ENEMY ENCAMPMENT — SAME And as the Savage Army starts to awaken, we start to hear AN UNGODLY HOWLING -- a great wailing and gnashing of tee as Gnomes realize they've been barbered -- Whimsies see they've been E-mask-ulated -- and they’re horrified -- be themselves -- can’t deal -- and so --
THEY RUN -- just go instant AWOL -- A MAD, MASS STAMPEDE collisions -- confusion -- Savages scattering in every direction -- as we hear a furious prolonged SCREECH and g
THEODORA comes running in -- now dressed head to toe in witchy black -- she heard the screech -- Evanora’s screec sees Evanora staring into the Crystal -- seething --
The Gnomes -- the Whimsies -- they're fleeing -- they’re gone.

I haven’t found them yet.
Soon as you do, you let me know. -- already on her way out, and we FOLLOW HER out to --

MUNCHKIN AND THE MASTER ELF -- hidden -- watch her fro below -- then go back to their secret preparations...
THE HAMMERHEADS AND FUDDLES have reached their destinatio  85.
Alright, everyone, spread out, and prepare yourselves...
EVANORA’s watching this all on her Crystal Ball --
Sister. The Enchanted Orchard...

To the Enchanted Orchard! Kill everyone you see! Go! (the Monkeys fly off) The rest of you: I want a line of sharpened steel between here and the Emerald City. The Growleywogs move out to form a Maginot Line across Central Oz. Meanwhile --
GLINDA frowns -- she senses -- knows --
The Winged Monkeys are on their way to the Orchard. Oz nods -- exhales -- here we go -- D-Day’s about to begi
SEEING: THE WINGED MONKEYS -- IN-COMING -- a dark cloud against the sky like a murder of evil crows.

Brace yourselves, men! Hold firm and wait until they land! THE FUDDLES straighten their shoulders, stiffen their spi There’s no sign of the Hammerheads.  86. NIKKO AND THE WINGED MONKEYS SWOOP IN -- hit the ground running -- drawing short swords from their belts -- and w horrific simian shrieks they come charging at: THE FUDDLES -- WHO IMMEDIATELY ALL FALL TO PIECES -- ever man-jack among them just fragments and collapses, and -- THE WINGED MONKEYS ARE CONFUSED -- their primitive little brains weren’t expecting this -- and they warily come for and start pawing through the puzzle piles -- inspect them with ignorant frowns -- and then, now that all the Monkey are here on the ground -- THE HAMMERHEADS ATTACK -- spring out from behind the tree and start jackhammering the Monkeys with their Jack-in-th Box heads -- ping-ponging the primates between them -- th FUDDLES QUICKLY RE-ASSEMBLE AND JOIN THE FIGHT, and --

text: -- high up into the branches, snapping off leaves and twi and apples -- and the Trees don’t like that one bit, and start WHALING ON THE WINGED MONKEYS -- limbs and branches just hammering the hell out of them, and soon --
THE MONKEYS ARE FINISHED -- every one of them TKO’ed. The Fuddles tie the Monkeys up. Victory is theirs.
GLINDA suddenly starts SMILING -- Oz sees it, and knows -
They did it? (off her nod) Now the Cuttenclips -- if they make it through. Her smile fades -- she shares his concern -- and we go --

location: ON SEVERAL DIFFERENT ROADS IN CENTRAL OZ

text: getting STOPPED by Growleywog Warriors. Some of the wagon are just waved on through -- others receive a rudimentary SEARCH -- which entails nothing more than a Growleywog jabbing his spear in the straw. Then they wave the Munchk on, and we END MONTAGE and go:

THE POPPY FIELDS — AFTERNOON And it is a Sea of Scarlet Poppies -- poppies whose odor according to Baum, ‘so powerful that anyone who breathes falls asleep, and if the sleeper is not carried away from scent of the flowers he sleeps on and on forever.’ THE MUNCHKIN TEAMSTERS have halted a safe distance from t fields, remove the hay and straw from the carts. THE

text: DISEMBARK -- some of them sporting the rips and tears the received from the points of probing Growleywog spears. TH PAPER SOLDIERS MARCH INTO POSITION -- form into rows in f of the rolling red fields -- mightily impressive, and --
EVANORA sees this on her Crystal Ball, says --
Sister...
THEODORA cocks an ear -- receives Evanora’s silent messag shouts to the Growleywog Warriors nearby --
To the Poppy Fields! Follow me! She hops on her broomstick -- takes off -- shoots down th line of Warriors -- spreading the word --
GLINDA's seeing this in her mind’s eye -- tells Oz --
Theodora and her Warriors are heading for the Poppy Fields.
Please don’t let there be a wind -- not yet --
I won't. Oz glances at Kala -- who’s quiet, worried -- clearly whatever's about to happen is crucial to Oz’s plan...  88.

FROM THE PAPER SOLDIERS’ POV: First they see THEODORA on broomstick -- a black onrushing dot in the sky -- then th loping ARMY OF GROWLEYWOGS, spear-tips flashing in the su FROM THE GROWLEYWOGS’ POV: A countless number of blue- jacketed Cuttenclips in front of the red, red fields.

Just remember they can’t kill you. Now water those pretty red flowers -- with pretty red blood. THE GROWLEYWOG GENERAL turns, raises his spear, lets out guttural war-cry, snaps his spear down -- and THE GROWLEY LET FLY WITH A THOUSAND ARROWS. THE CUTTENCLIP SOLDIERS look up -- see this arrow-storm sizzling towards them -- the Cuttenclips stand their grou and_the arrows pass right through them -- not a single soldier falls, and --
THEODORA’s stunned -- What just happened? -- and --
(eyes closed) Now... And she puffs out her cheeks and BLOWS, and --

text: BACK INTO THE POPPIES -- so it looks like they’re retreat -- and the GROWLEYWOG WARRIORS GO CHARGING UP THE HILL -- whooping like banshees -- a sound to freeze the blood, an DEEPER IN THE POPPY FIELDS -- Glinda’s wind keeps flutter the Cuttenclips farther into the flowers -- and THEODORA senses something’s wrong -- and shrieks --

NO! IT’S A TRICK! DON’T --! THE GROWLEYWOGS don’t listen -- blood lust high -- and _ full battle cry they set upon the Cuttenclips -- STABBING SLASHING -- RIPPING the Soldiers to shreds -- but then... poppies start working their narcotic magic...  89.

head_text.subj: THE GROWLEYWOG WARRIORS START DROPPING LIKE OPIATED FLIES

text: soon every last one of them is in a deep, drugged sleep..
THEODORA can’t believe it -- for the briefest little mome we see a flicker of fear -- then her eyes narrow --

Deftly done, Wizard -- and Glinda too, I’m sure. But you haven’t won yet -- far from it. See you at Emerald City -- my sister and I will be waiting... And she jets off on her broom, back to Emerald City, and
Our turn now.
Showtime.

A very dark night... SAVAGE GUARDSMEN patrol the gates -- GROWLEYWOG WARRIOR mans the ramparts above -- then he hea something, quickly wheels to his left to see: KALA -- ZOOMING THROUGH THE AIR TOWARDS HIM -- towards us fist cocked and: POW! -- Kala crunches a punch into the Growleywog's jaw, knocking him cold -- the Savage goes do in a heap, his spear clattering onto stone, and -- OTHER SAVAGE SENTRIES hear it, come racing to investigate see KALA -- who scampers -- on foot -- and THE SAVAGES GI CHASE -- and when the balustrade is clear... THE MAGIC BUBBLE wafts in -- OZ AND GLINDA have arrived i City -- but before they separate, Glinda smiles --
Welcome to your Destiny. And Oz is as honest as he’s ever been in his life --

I didn’t do this for Destiny. I did it for you.  90. Then quickly, he turns and goes -- Glinda gazing after hi then she pulls up the hood of her cloak, hiding her face cowl. She moves off, into the shadows, while --
KALA’s still leading the Guards on a helluva chase, and -

GLINDA moves along the stone wall -- her hand against it then pauses as if she’s listening to something far beyond hearing -- and then... SHE STEPS THROUGH THE WALL -- just walks through solid stone, into --
EVANORA’s on the Emerald Throne -- doesn’t even turn arou as Glinda silently materializes behind her.
I've been expecting you.
Of course you have. You knew this day would come.
I’m sorry -- am I supposed to be frightened? -- of you or this false Wizard of yours?
False Wizard...?
Don’t tell me you believe --
In him? As a matter of fact I do.
You always were so gullible.
Yes, once upon a time I even believed in you.  gl.

You believed in our friendship. And you believed that, deep down, there was some Good inside me... (sneers) You were foolish then, you’re foolish now -- too foolish, I think, to live. Wouldn’t you agree, Sister?
Definitely. Glinda slowly turns -- and there’s Theodora.
So good to see you again, Glinda.
Don’t you look lovely.
Yes, don’t I -- I’m sure your Wizard would say the same -- he did tell me green’s his favorite color.
Then I’m sure he’ll enjoy sitting on the Emerald Throne.
You mean my throne.
I mean my father’s throne. Oz the Great and Powerful will be sitting there by morning.
(cackles ) The Great and Powerful --?!
Just you wait -- you'll see. Then, just as LIGHTNING flashes from Theodora’s fingers, Glinda abruptly VANISHES INTO THIN AIR. Theodora scowls..
What if she’s right? What if the Wizard is --?  92.
-- he’s not -- as will be proved to you by morning -- for by morning he’1l be dead.
That's a pity. I wanted to kill him slow.
He slips around a corner -- sees, up ahead, in the shadow M. MUNCHKIN -- gesturing: This way -- but then --

Oz wheels, sees: SIX WINKIE GUARDSMEN... M. Munchkin quic slips back into his hiding place as the Guardsmen advance Oz -- spears raised -- the steel circle closing -- Oz see escape -- so, thinking fast --
There who is?
You, Wizard. -- spear-points now inches from 0z, who somehow laughs --
Wizard? Me? I’m not the Wizard! And the Guardsmen hesitate...
Yes you are -- sure you are.

How could I be? Gentlemen: Look at me! I’m just a man, and haven’t you heard? The Wizard of Oz is ten feet tall -- he breathes smoke and fire -- he is by all accounts and by any stretch of the imagination --

But that’s as far as he gets, because: SUDDENLY THE WINKI GUARDSMEN ALL COLLAPSE TO THE FLOOR -- their bodies seem just disappear, leaving behind a jumble of hats and cloak and spears, then... RATS START WRIGGLING OUT FROM UNDER T MUDDLE -- the transformed Winkie Guardsmen -- courtesy of GLINDA -- to whom a greatly relieved Oz says --  93.
Thought you’d never get here. Come on! M. Munchkin reappears -- Oz and Glinda follow him into th shadows, as we start to hear: THE TOLLING OF A BELL...

KALA’'S RINGING THE BELL -- hauling on the rope like a cr Quasimodo -- barricaded here in this tower while, outside the SAVAGE GUARDS TRY TO BREAK DOWN THE DOOR. And as the bell continues to loudly Ding and Dong...
THE CITIZENS OF EM CITY come out of their houses -- wonde what all the commotion’s about, and --
The SAVAGES successfully smash the door down -- Kala flie out the tower window -- safely away, and --
THE EM CITY CITIZENS gather in the Central Square... SAVA PALACE GUARDS keep them well back from the Palace, and --
THE MASTER ELF is peering out.
Close the curtain. The Elf turns, and we see: Oz -- standing inside a circle very strange-looking CAMERA DEVICES. He says to Glinda --
Let’s begin. Glinda gives a sharp wave of her hand, and just like that
All the torches in the city go out.  94.
Glinda pulls the cowl back over her head, smiles at Oz.
Ad_ astra per aspera.
E Pluribus Unum. Glinda heads out -- Oz says to the Master Elf --
Here we go.
DRY-ICE SMOKE starts billowing in from all sides -- huggi the ground -- prompting murmurs from the crowd... then: f
And even before the smoke clears we hear -- booming, amplified -- like the Voice of God Himself...

head_text.subj: DO NOT FEAR, GOOD PEOPLE OF OZ --

text: And then, under the Arch -- we see it -- see him: A LARGE THAN-LIFE HOLOGRAM OF 0Z -- spectral, see-through --
GEYSERS OF FIRE shoot up on either side of the Hologram.
We are here... EVANORA AND THEODORA -- ON THE PALACE BALCONY. Theodora flicks a hand -- the TORCHES next to them REIGNITE.

And we are anxious to see just how Great and Powerful you truly are. Theodora signals -- and the PALACE GUARDSMAN RUSH THE HOLOGRAM -- SHOOTING ARROWS and FLINGING SPEARS -- which harmlessly pass right through the Image of Oz -- and when

spears and arrows hit the floor...  95. GLINDA -- in her shawl -- gestures -- AND THE SPEARS AND ARROWS TRANSFORM INTO SNAKES -- and go slithering off int the shadows... THE HOLOGRAM LAUGHS WITH SCORN.

Oz motions to the Master Elf -- Cut! -- then steps up clo to a single, larger camera-type device, and --
When the Fireball dies out we see... Oz’s Image is gone. There’s nothing there under the Arch any longer. THE WICK SISTERS CACKLE -- triumphant -- but only for a moment...
Oz signals -- the Master Elf flicks a switch, and --
Another terrific BOOOOOM! of smoke and fire erupts under Arch -- and this time when the clouds clear we see:

Like the face Dorothy will see when she goes to see the Wizard years from now -- and THE MOON FACE starts to grow gets BIGGER and BIGGER... then it starts FLOATING UP into air... and as it rises, in a voice like rolling thunder -
Doubt you? -- I DEFY you!

AND THE SKY SEEMS TO EXPLODE! And, as Oz himself would probably say it, what follows is: ‘A FIREWORKS FANTASIA M

text: And we can tell: All this zapping is sapping Theodora’s strength. The lightning first dims -- then fades out completely -- and she slumps against the railing.
Sister?  97. GLINDA -- DOWN BELOW -- IN THE SHADOWS - smiles to hersel then THRUSTS her hand up and forward -- and _some great shimmering PULSE OF ENERGY flashes up to the balcony -- T

SURGE SLAMS INTO THE SISTERS -- knocks Evanora clear thro the doorway -- she goes sliding on her backside along the floor -- her hair awry -- animal fear in her eyes for the very first time -- THEODORA’s still on the balcony -- on hands and knees -- the Sisters lock eyes.
We must leave.
The night is his. We leave and there will be other nights. THEODORA’s wavering -- then a ROMAN CANDLE slams into the Palace wall right beside her -- EXPLODES IN A SUPERNOVA O RED, WHITE AND BLUE.
she’s being bombarded -- rockets and Roman Candles strafi the Palace walls -- she has to duck and cover -- snarling with rage -- shrieks towards 0z’s Moon Face --

THIS ISN’T OVER, WIZARD! Mark my words: You will watch each other die! She runs into the Palace, helps her Sister to her feet -- the two Wicked Witches beat a hasty retreat down the hall INT. THEODORA’S ROOM Theodora grabs her broomstick, flings open the window. Lo back -- Evanora’s just standing there -- looks devastated
Curse them -- curse them all.

Don’t worry, Sister, we will. All in good time. Evanora nods -- regally walks past Theodora to the window raises her arms, the long folds of her sleeves spreading wings -- then SHE TAKES OFF -- soaring like a nighthawk - THEODORA SAILS AFTER HER -- ON HER BROOM --—  98.
Kala sees the Wicked Sisters flying away -- has a TRUMPET looped on a strap -- he BLARES A TANTARA --

Kala rushes in -- charged up -- Monkey-laughing --
We did it, Wizard -- you did it! The Wicked Witches: Gone-gone! Oz beams -- Glinda steps through the curtain -- all aglow
You were wonderful.
Yeah, that’s me: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. He sweeps her into his arms, is about to kiss her, when -
What are you doing!
I was... trying to kiss you.
But I’m a Witch.
Believe me, I’ve kissed worse.
But... my kiss would kill you. A searching beat -- then he sets her down.
You mean... kill me kill me? --
